Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Ringer \Ring"er\, n. 1. One who, or that which, rings; especially, one who rings chimes on bells. [1913 Webster]
2. (Mining) A crowbar. --Simmonds. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Ringer \Ring"er\, n. (Horse Racing) A horse that is not entitled to take part in a race, but is fraudulently got into it. [1913 Webster]

ringer n 1: a person who rings church bells (as for summoning the congregation) [syn: {toller}, {bell ringer}] 2: a person who is almost identical to another [syn: {dead ringer}, {clone}] 3: a contestant entered in a competition under false pretenses 4: (horseshoes) the successful throw of a horseshoe or quoit so as to encircle a stake or peg
